dataStructure.name: sid.org.tmforum.tip.resource.res.compound.ResourcePort
dataStructure.description:
The ResourcePort class was defined in DEN-ng because many of the ITU and IETF specifications refer to a "port", but use this as both a physical as well as a logical concept. This will enable the semantics of the ITU and IETF specifications to be correctly mined and used in the DEN-ng specification. The ResourcePort class abstracts the concept of a set of Ports from G.805, and is a type of ResourceElement that consists only of logical termination points (TrailTerminationPointSource, TrailTerminationPointSink, and TrailTerminationPointBiDirectional, to be precise) and PhysicalPorts. This enables the ResourcePort to take on the physical and logical characteristics of a "port" as defined in G.805.

This entity is optional
dataStructure.label: ResourcePort

child.name: isEdgeResourcePort
child.description:
This is a Boolean attribute. If the value of this attribute is TRUE, then this ResourcePort is located at the edge of a Network or SubNetwork.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: isEdgeResourcePort

child.name: terminationPoint
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity 0..*

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is an end of association TPAspectCompoundResourceDetails

This association end is optional
child.label: terminationPoint

child.name: physicalPort
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity 0..*

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is an end of association PPortAspectCompoundResourceDetails

This association end is optional
child.label: physicalPort
